{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a postmenopausal woman with vaginal spotting and a mass on pelvic exam. The most appropriate next step in management is to perform a biopsy of the mass to evaluate for malignancy. A Pap smear is not indicated in this case as it is a screening test for cervical cancer and does not evaluate vaginal masses. Incision and drainage is not appropriate as there is no indication for an abscess.
